column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of Sr1 -x L a xF eO3 were prepared\rby the following two-step method.
#Text=First, polycrystalline samples\rof the oxygen deficient perovskites Sr1 -x L a xF eO3 -δ were\rsynthesized by a conventional solid-state reaction.
#Text=The starting\rmaterials (SrCO3 , La 2O 3 , and Fe2 O3 ) were stoichiometrically mixed and sintered at 900-1250 ℃ in air for 12-24 h.
#Text=The obtained powder was\rpelletized and sintered again at 1300 ℃ for 24 h in a flow of Ar\rgas.
#Text=Second, the sintered sample was sealed in a gold capsule\rwith an oxidizing agent (NaClO3 ), and annealed at 500 ℃ and 8\rGPa for 1 h using a cubic-anvil-type high-pressure apparatus.
#Text=Synchrotron powder X-ray diffraction (XRD) was\rperformed at beamline 8A, Photon Factory, KEK, Japan.
#Text=The\rwavelengths of synchrotron X-ray in the range from 0.68975 Å\rto 0.68987 Å were calibrated for each compound by a standard\rsample of CeO2 .

#Text=Crystal structures were refined by Rietveld\ranalyses using RIETAN-FP.1 9 Bond valence sum (BVS) for the\rFe ion was calculated by BVS = Σi exp((r0 ri)/\r0.37) ,\rwhere ri represents the Fe-O bond length. r0 for each\rcomposition was obtained by the linear interpolation between\r1.759 (Fe3 +, x = 1) and 1.78 (Fe4 +, x = 0).2 0 Magnetic properties\rand resistivity were measured with MPMS and PPMS (Quantum\rDesign), respectively.
